CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) - A material name entity that refers to the highest energy molecular orbital in a molecule or material.
2. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) - A material name entity that refers to the lowest energy molecular orbital in a molecule or material.
3. D-A (Donor-Acceptor) - A material name entity that refers to a type of copolymer where the donor and acceptor units are arranged in a specific structure.
4. Thiophene - A material name entity that refers to a type of organic compound containing a five-membered ring of carbon and sulfur atoms.
5. Dithiophene - A material name entity that refers to a type of organic compound containing two fused benzene rings and a sulfur atom.
6. Bridged dithiophene - A material name entity that refers to a type of dithiophene where a bridging group is attached to the two benzene rings.
7. Cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT) - A material name entity that refers to a specific type of bridged dithiophene.
8. Dithienosilole (DTS) - A material name entity that refers to a type of organic compound containing a silicon atom in place of a carbon atom in the dithiophene structure.
9. Dithienogermole (DTG) - A material name entity that refers to a type of organic compound containing a germanium atom in place of a carbon atom in the dithiophene structure.
10. Dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP) - A material name entity that refers to a specific type of dithieno compound containing a pyrrole ring.
11. Benzothiadiazole (BT) - A material name entity that refers to a type of organic compound containing a benzene ring and a thiadiazole ring.
12. PC 70 BM - A material name entity that refers to a specific type of fullerene derivative.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the material name entities in the text:

1. Thiophene
2. Dithiophene
3. DTP

These are the only entities in the text that refer directly to material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid material name entities in the text, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Thiophene |
| Dithiophene |
| DTP |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Donor unit:
 * Thiophene
 * Bridged dithiophene (CPDT, DTS, DTG, DTP)
2. Acceptor unit:
 * Benzothiadiazole (BT)
 * 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT)
3. Other materials:
 * Alkanedithiols
 * PC 70 BM (polymeric material)

Note that some of these materials are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have only listed each one once in the appropriate category.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph, after removing irrelevant entities:

1. Thiophene
2. Dithiophene
3. Benzothiadiazole
4. DTBT

These are the property names of materials that are clearly mentioned in the paragraph as the names of materials used in the synthesis of polymers for photovoltaic applications.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid property names mentioned in the paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Thiophene |
| Dithiophene |
| Benzothiadiazole |
| DTBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Band gap:
The paragraph mentions that the band gap of D-A type copolymers can be well tuned by the choice of D and A units. However, it does not provide specific values for the band gap of the different materials mentioned.
2. HOMO and LUMO:
The paragraph mentions that the HOMO and LUMO of D-A type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units, respectively. However, it does not provide specific values for the HOMO and LUMO of the different materials mentioned.
3. Mobility:
The paragraph mentions that polymers based on DTS (dithienosilole) normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum, which results in an improvement in photovoltaic performance. However, it does not provide specific values for the hole mobility of DTS.
4. Steric hindrance:
The paragraph mentions that a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance, which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. However, it does not provide specific values for the steric hindrance of the different materials mentioned.
5. Solubility:
The paragraph mentions that DTP (planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole) shows good π-conjugation and great potential for use in organic electronic materials. However, it does not provide specific values for the solubility of DTP.
6. Short-circuit current:
The paragraph mentions that PSCs (polymer solar cells) based on DTP-containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short-circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1, indicating that DTP-containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. However, it does not provide specific values for the short-circuit current of the different materials mentioned.
7. Fullerene derivatives:
The paragraph mentions that blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4%. However, it does not provide specific values for the PCE of the different fullerene derivatives used.
8. Imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen:
The paragraph mentions that benzothiadiazole (BT) containing the electron-withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. However, it does not provide specific values for the imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen content of the different BT-containing copolymers.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.
